titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Lionel and I left the Castle a few minutes before 9 a.m., and motored to Barrow in Furness by way of Barnard Castle, Penrith, Pooley Bridge and Ulverston, & we arrived at 12.35 p.m. having travelled 106 miles. Our road ran beside Lakes Ullswater & Windermere, which showed all their glorious beauty in a bright sun. The autumnal colouring was exquisite. The Bishop of Carlisle and M
Williams gave us lunch at the Victoria Park Hotel, and then followed the meeting of the Diocesan Conference.

and I were the 'invited speakers', and the subject was the Revised Prayer Book. I spoke first for about half an hour. The members listened attentively, and applauded adequately. It needs no saying that the atmosphere of the Hall was asphyxiating. I came away as soon as I decently could, & we motored back to Auckland – 101 miles – by the main southerly route
